name: num::nonzero::NonZero::<u64>::rotate_left

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

num::<impl u64>::rotate_left.doc:
Shifts the bits to the left by a specified amount, `n`,
 wrapping the truncated bits to the end of the resulting integer.

 `rotate_left(n)` is equivalent to applying `rotate_left(1)` a total of `n` times. In
 particular, a rotation by the number of bits in `self` returns the input value
 unchanged.

 Please note this isn't the same operation as the `<<` shifting operator!

 # Examples

 ```

 ```

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecke.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.
